Sentencas: This study investigates the electrical performance of a planar solid oxide fuel cell unit with cross-flow configuration when the fuel utilization gets higher and the fuel inlet flows are nonuniform.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization

Sentencas: A numerical code, solving the two-dimensional, simultaneous, partial differential equations of mass, energy, and electrochemistry and neglecting the stack direction variation effect, is developed.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization

Sentencas: The results show that the fuel utilization increases with a decrease in the molar flow rate, and the average current density decreases when the molar flow rate drops.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization

Sentencas: In addition, nonuniform pattern A induces more severe happening of nonreaction area in the corner of the fuel exit and the air inlet.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization

Sentencas: This nonreaction area deteriorates the average current density and then reduces the electrical performance to 7%.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization

Sentencas: This study suggests that the fuel inlet manifold should be located far from the inlet of air, which is able to decrease the deterioration to below 3% when using nonuniform profile of pattern B. On the other hand, employing a suitable air flow rate, we can easily control the operating temperature of a solid oxide fuel cell unit and the effect of nonuniform inlet air flow rate on the temperature distribution becomes negligible.
Titulo: Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization
Electrical and Thermal Performance of a Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Unit With Nonuniform Inlet Flow and High Fuel Utilization
